content: crochet pattern short-sleeved pullover jumper notes yarn worsted weight hook 5 5 mm gauge 12 double_crochet and 8 double_crochet row in 4 standard us terminology is used abbreviations slip_stitch = slip_stitch chain = chain stitch fdc = foundation double_crochet use ch2 if you prefer double_crochet = double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet for different gauges work row 6 until under bust measurement is achieved by the two larger sections in between the v-stitches combined sizing this pattern makes a size small/medium jumper measures 34 inches at the bust and 12 inches from armpit to hem model is 5 9 to make larger sizes repeat row 6 until desired under-bust and arm hole measurements have been achieved before proceeding use chain 2 for first double_crochet of each row instead of fdc if you prefer pattern row 1 chain 100 join with slip_stitch to first chain row 2 fdc double_crochet in each chain join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet 100 double_crochet row 3 chain 2 skip first double_crochet *fpdc in next double_crochet bpdc in next double_crochet* repeat ** to end of row join with sl st to first double_crochet row 4 repeat row 3 ensure fpdc is worked on fpdc and bpdc is worked on bpdc row 5 fdc double_crochet in next 29 double_crochet double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in next double_crochet double_crochet in next 18 double_crochet double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in next double_crochet double_crochet in next 30 double_crochet double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in next double_crochet double_crochet in next 18 double_crochet double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in last double_crochet slip_stitch to join row 6-13 fdc double_crochet in next and in each double_crochet to end and double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in each chain space slip_stitch to join row 14 fdc double_crochet in next double_crochet and in every double_crochet until next chain space skip next 36 double_crochet until next chain space double_crochet in every double_crochet until next chain space slip_stitch to join work has been divided into body and sleeves row 15 - ~row 32 fdc and double_crochet in next and in each double_crochet to end slip_stitch to join or until desired length is reached row 33 chain 2 skip first double_crochet *fpdc in next double_crochet bpdc in next double_crochet* repeat ** to end of row join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet row 34 repeat row 3 ensure fpdc is worked on fpdc and bpdc is worked on bpdc fasten_off sleeves slip_stitch to join at armhole opening row 1 fdc double_crochet in next double_crochet and in each double_crochet until end slip_stitch to join row 2 repeat row 1 to make longer sleeves repeat row 1 until desired length row 3 chain 2 skip first double_crochet *fpdc in next double_crochet bpdc in next double_crochet* repeat ** to end of row join with sl st to first double_crochet row 4 repeat row 3 ensure fpdc is worked on fpdc and bpdc is worked on bpdc fasten_off
